title: Snail

adjectives: Slow; having little motion; as, a sluggish stream.
Not moving quickly; taking a comparatively long time
Not happening in a short time; spread over a comparatively long time.
Spread over a comparatively long time.
verbs: Advance slowly, as if by inches
nouns: Snail is a common name that is applied most often to land snails, terrestrial pulmonate gastropod molluscs.
Any of very many animals (either hermaphroditic or nonhermaphroditic), of the class Gastropoda, having a coiled shell.
Any animal of the class Gastropoda having a shell.
Freshwater or marine or terrestrial gastropod mollusk usually having an external enclosing spiral shell
(Gastropoda) Ventral footed mollusk, including land snails, terrestrial pulmonate gastropod mollusks.

description:
A snail, a slow-moving, snail-like mollusk in a spiraling shell. Generally depicted as a brown snail in full profile facing left or right, with a brown, textured shell and tentacle-like eyes.

May be used to represent a slug and various senses of slow.

Twitter’s snail has a purple body and yellow shell. Microsoft’s snail previously had a green body.
apple_vendor_description: Apple's snail emoji presents a charming, stylized creature with its shell spiraling elegantly and its body slightly extended. Crafted with Apple's hallmark glossy 3D shading and soft rounded edges, it possesses a delightful, almost tactile quality. The realistic lighting accentuates the subtle texture of the shell and the gentle curve of the snail's form, making it a sweet visual for representing slowness, patience, or a leisurely pace.
